info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 29 at 3:46PM EDT until April 30 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Jersey. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Portions of southern New Jersey and the NJ Coast saw anywhere from 2 to 5+ inches of rain over the past 24 hours. Another 1 to 2 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts possible. Some small stream flooding has been observed already. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
